markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: ## Week 5 Lesson 1 ### Last lesson - DOM - document.getElementbyId - document.getElementsByTagName - document.getElementsByClassName Is the following code correct? ```js document.getElementsByTagName('p').style.backgroundColor = '#ff0000'; ``` ### Exercise J Write a function that takes an id as a parameter, it should look for an element with that id and remove all it’s child elements. Is it correct? ```js function deleteAllChildById(id) { var element = document.getElementById(id); var allChild = element.children; console.log(allChild); for (var i = 0; i < allChild.length; i++) { element.removeChild(allChild[i]); } } ``` Is it correct? ```js function removeChildrenById2(id) { var parent = document.getElementById(id); while (parent.firstChild) { parent.removeChild(parent.firstChild); } } ``` Is it correct? ```js function removeChildrenById(id) { document.getElementById(id).innerHTML = ''; } ``` ### Flower shop plus (with JavaScript) Let’s go back to our little website we coded in the HTML / CSS introduction. See picture below for inspiration: - Once the user hovers over the 4 icons, they should increase in size by 40%, once the users mouse leaves the icons their size should decrease to normal again - Make the Learn More button clickable. Once the user clicks on it: 1. Remove the black overlay so that we can see the flowers clearly. 2. Change the title from ‘beautiful flowers’ to ‘welcome to my flower shop’, give the text a background and change the color to blue. 3. Change the text of the button from ‘learn more’ to ‘buy flowers’, change the background color to red. ## Bonus If you can change the documents style with a button, try to change it back when the user clicks the button again.
